meanings.definition: Frasses (verb): to scatter or spread widely
meanings.sent1: The wind frasses the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: She frasses the seeds in the garden for planting.
meanings.sent3: The kids frasses the toys all over the living room.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident frasses through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The chef frasses the herbs on top of the dish for garnish.

meanings.sent1: The construction site was filled with frasses after the demolition.
meanings.sent2: The beach was covered in frasses washed up by the tide.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel collected frasses to build its nest in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The river carried frasses downstream after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The janitor swept up the frasses left behind by the party guests.

meanings.sent1: Her room was frasses with clothes and books scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The frasses desk made it hard to find anything in the office.
meanings.sent3: The frasses hair of the clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The frasses schedule caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The frasses painting had colors splattered in all directions.
